ID1.question: Please indicate your knowledge/involvement with SBOMs (Software Bill of Materials), by selecting all the options that apply to you:

roles.producer: I create SBOMs for the software projects I am involved in
roles.consumer: I use the SBOMs of software projects I am involved in or third-party software components/dependencies
roles.tool_developer: I create tools that generate or process SBOMs
roles.standard_maker: I am involved in defining standards / specifications for SBOMs
roles.educator: I develop, compile, and/or apply educational resources related to SBOMs
roles.unfamilar: I am not familiar with SBOMs

S1.question: Please briefly describe the concept of SBOMs. What are they? What is their purpose?

S2.question: Which SBOM format(s) do you use?

S3.question: Please list which data fields you think should be included in SBOMs.

S4.question: Indicate your agreement with the following statement: The use of SBOMs is critical in software development.

S5.question: What deficiencies currently exist in SBOM standards / specifications?

S6.question: How can we address current deficiencies in SBOM standards / specifications?

S7.question: Indicate your agreement with the following statement: "Current SBOM tool support meets the needs of users."

S8.question: How can we address current deficiencies in SBOM tooling?

S9.question: How would you prefer SBOMs be distributed? Rank by preference by dragging the options.
options: Located in repositories along with source code
Available from the project developers upon request

S10.question: (Optional) Feel free to explain you preferences about how SBOMs should be distributed.

P2.question: At what point(s) in the software development process should SBOMs be generated? (select all that apply)

P3.question: Why do you create SBOMs? (select all that apply)

P4.question: (Optional) Please elaborate on the benefits from creating SBOMS that you identified.

P5.question: What tool(s) do you use to assist the creation of SBOMs, if any?

P7.question: Does your organization have strategies for managing SBOM versions?

P8.question: What strategies does your organization have for managing SBOM versions? Are there any specific tools involved?

P9.question: What issues have you faced when creating SBOMs? Feel free to give examples.

C2.question: What do you use SBOMs for? (select all that apply)

C3.question: (Optional) Please elaborate on the benefits from consuming SBOMS that you identified.

C4.question: How often do you use SBOMs during software development?

C5.question: Do you process or analyze the SBOMs of the software dependencies that you use (if available)?

C6.question: How do you process or analyze the SBOMs of your dependencies? What tools, if any, are involved in the process?

C7.question: What issues have you faced when consuming SBOMs? Feel free to give examples.

T2.question: Which SBOM format(s) does your tool(s) support?

T3.question: What do you use SBOMs for? (select all that apply)

T4.question: Who is your tool primarily designed for? (select all that apply)

T5.question: Indicate your agreement with the following statement: "In my industry, developers and other stakeholders are aware of the SBOM tools available to them."

T6.question: Which SBOM tools have you developed (or helped develop)? Please give their names.

SM2.question: Where should standards / specifications regarding SBOM creation and usage originate from?

SM3.question: How should SBOM standards / specifications be effectively communicated?

E2.question: Indicate your agreement with the following statement: “Software stakeholders understand the purposes / capabilities of SBOMs.”

E3.question: Indicate your agreement with the following statement: “Software stakeholders understand how to use SBOMs.”

E4.question: Which SBOM format(s) do you teach about / compile resources for?

E5.question: What types of resources are best to inform people about SBOMs? Rank by preference by dragging the options.
options: Integration of SBOM functionality into existing tools

SC1.question: Indicate your agreement with the following statement: “Vulnerabilities reported for software dependencies I use are important issues for my organization.”

SC2.question: Are you involved with writing, reviewing, or maintaining source code?

SC3.question: Indicate your agreement with the following statement: “I trust security scanners and static analysis tools to find vulnerabilities in my code.”

SC4.question: Indicate your agreement with the following statement: “I trust that my dependencies are free from security vulnerabilities.”

SC5.question: Do you use a dependency tracking system (e.g. Eclipse SW360, ORT, OWASP Dependency-Track)?

SC6.question: If you use a dependency tracking system (e.g. Eclipse SW360, ORT, OWASP Dependency-Track, etc.), does it allow you to easily determine if your project is impacted by a discovered upstream vulnerability?

SC7.question: What dependency tracking system do you use, and how does it allow you to determine if your project is impacted by a discovered upstream vulnerability?

SC8.question: How do you evaluate the security vulnerabilities of the dependencies you use?

SC9.question: In the software that you develop, how do you obtain the list of libraries that it uses? Feel free to provide details about any tools used.

Q1.question: How many years of experience in software development do you have?

Q2.question: How would you describe your primary role?

Q3.question: What is your highest level of education?

Q4.question: Which programming languages have you most used in past project(s)?

Q5.question: What types of systems have you developed?

Q7.question: For which domains (e.g., banking or healthcare) have you developed applications / systems?

Q6.question: Do you primarily work on open source or closed source projects?

Q8.question: Do you have a background in computer security? Formal (college classes, degree, certification) or informal (self-learning or other training)?

Q9.question: Do you have a background in software licensing? Formal (college classes, degree, certification) or informal (self-learning or other training)?

Q10.question: How often did you release or help release a new major version of an application / software over the past two years? Please give your best estimate; if you develop more than one software / application, please answer based on the most frequently updated software / application.

Q11.question: Which country / countries are you and / or your organization based in?

Q12.question: Please enter your email address. This will be used to contact you for compensation. If we are interested in your responses, we may contact you for a follow-up interview, if you are willing.
